definitions.definition: one or the other of two; it does not matter which

examples.text: You can park on either side of the street.
Either of these approaches will help you reduce costs.
There are two types of qualification—either is acceptable.
The offices on either side were empty.
There's a door at either end of the corridor.

wordOrigin: Old English ǣgther, contracted form of ǣg(e)hwæther, of Germanic origin; ultimately related to aye and whether.
